text:
Kumail Nanjiani (born February 21, 1978) is a Pakistani-American stand-up comedian, actor, podcast host and writer.
He is also known as the voice of Prismo on the Emmy Award-winning animated series "Adventure Time". He starred on the TNT series "Franklin & Bash" and the Adult Swim series "Newsreaders".
In 2017, Nanjiani starred in the semi-autobiographical romantic comedy movie "The Big Sick" set in Chicago, which he wrote with his wife Emily V. Gordon. They were nominated for the Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay at the 90th Academy Awards.

annotations.surface_form: Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay
